Reviews.Title: “great for a brief sleep over...”
Reviews.Author: jayman224 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great location and spot for a quick sleep. The rooms whilst not much bigger than a shoebox are very well appointed with separate bathroom. The front desk service was good. the hotel is so compact that my bag was stored for me before checkin in the disabled toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean....”
Reviews.Author: JaxxRotorua
Reviews.Content: Room was small but you expect that with the ibis. Was clean and tidy and so central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A cupboard, not a room!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie J
Reviews.Content: We could not believe the size of our "standard" room. With a lovely foam queen mattress, we had about 8 inches spaces either side of the bed, with the ensuite so close to where we slept that we could have touched the toilet with our legs if the door had not been there. Such a very small room, with no ventilation, could not wait to leave. Staff friendly, services good, but size of room has to be seen to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: AGaussie
Reviews.Content: What a grea hotel to stay in for some great time away in Sydney! So close to the harbour with great restaurants. Great reception staff - very helpful - and fabulous, new, clean rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Juany63 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay at the hotel. Staff were really friendly and helpful! The room was a tad small but for my needs it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: SouthSeasAmerican
Reviews.Content: The location is the main thing. My wife and I had important business to do in the Sydney CBD, and this was in walking distance of the offices we needed to visit. It is also three blocks from the train station and one block from King Street Wharf on Darling Harbor. The room was small but clean. The desk lamp did not work but I did not want to interrupt my paperwork to get it fixed. The staff helped me resolve a credit card mix-up and they helped me get some photocopies made when I needed them late at night. They did not charge me extra for my infant daughter. It seemed to be one of the best values in the very high-priced CDB. I give them a 3 for facility but a 5 for service and a 5 for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: BruderLustig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December; yes the room was small but kind of cozy; despite the tightness there was still room for a coffee/tea maker ; like it. Can't complain about the location ; very central and within easy foot walks to either harbour area. Nice restaurants/ delis around in the neighborhood for breakfast/lunch or diner. so overall, pretty good value to explore this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Start of a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Monegeetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before going on a cruise to NZ. The rooms were small, clean & comfortable. Breakfast was $20AU for all you could eat, very good value and the range is excellent. The Hotel is close to everything, shops, Darling Harbour and the rail network. This is the 3rd Ibis we have stayed at and so far we have not been disappointed. I booked and paid online and luckly brought a print out showing I had paid for the 3 rooms as the young lady on the front desk tried to say we had not paid. I gave her the print out and left her to correctly read her computer screen whilst we went and enjoyed our Cruise on Holland America. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: esmari3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2012. When we checked in, we had a "touristy" question and the person manning e desk didn't know much. It was a little disappointing. The room is small, but clean and has everything you need for a short stay. We stayed 4 night and although the towels were changed, the bed was never made properly and the sheets not changed once. I'm not sure how long you have to stay for before that happens? The hotel's location is absolutely wonderful - easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, The Rocks and Circular Quay, but it is right next to the freeway flighover and after spending the first night with little sleep, I bought ear plugs on day 2 and had a much better sleep. Every sound is also heard from the rooms above and next to you, so ear plugs are recommended. All in all, we'll probably recommend people to stay there since it is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Out to see the big smoke”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the city, central to everything. easy walking to the harbour and Darling Harbour and the Monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller12323
Reviews.Content: The location was good and the rooms were what I expectec (with an amazing shower). However if you have a room along the on-ramp for the freeway, don't think you will get much sleep. Request a room on the opposite side and your experience may be more enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Compact rooms but great service!”
Reviews.Author: whiteduck
Reviews.Content: Room was compact, modern and clean. From arrival through to departure we cannot fault the front-desk staff and restaurant manager; special thanks go to Patrick and Belinda for helping tracking and forwarding my driving licence. Well situated close to Darling Harbour (5 minutes) and a great coffee shop next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Royzer79
Reviews.Content: Some people make me laugh, hotel really nice has everything you want, normally when people stay in hotel your either there for holiday short brake in sydney, your not going to spend the week in your room or weekend, end of the day once the room is clean and bed is comfortable wat more can you ask for, a lot of people that leave bad reviews here I think they should stop look at "keeping up appearances" hyacinth and Richard ha ha ha ha ha ha

Reviews.Title: “best ibis ever”
Reviews.Author: patrickjamins
Reviews.Content: i stayed in few ibis hotel in my life but this one Wow!!! perfect nice room,friendly staff, big rooms, very clean, ipod duck, nice vue on darling harbour( still small windows) but very cosy the only down side will be the charge on wifi and some tv channel.over all i relly enjoyed my stay there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, modern and clean rooms - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brendan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Ibis Kings Wharf in November 2011 on a business trip. The hotel is in an excellent location, just a 30 second walk away from many restaurants on Darling Harbour. The rooms are not very big (but perfectly adequate), and very clean and modern. The bathroom was also perfectly fine. The staff were excellent and all my questions were answered with a smile! I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small and oh did I mention small!”
Reviews.Author: SorchaOS
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to it being new, good location and reasonably priced. I wasn't disappointed with the location, it's very easy to get around from here, there are buses all around and it's literally a 2 minute walk to the Darling Harbour precint. However, for me that's where the positives stop really. When I arrived, the guy behind reception was very welcoming and polite, I cannot fault him for that. However what I can fault is how he told me I was "lucky" that they had rooms available when he could not find my internet booking. I had a booking confirmation therefore I get a room. Whether your computer system is "synced" correctly or not is not of my concern and I don't really think it was an appropriate way to address the issue. He also repeatedly kept asking if it was "just" me for the room. It felt very pointed, and when I got to the room I realised why for there is no possible way that there is a smaller room in that hotel to the one that I was given. I did know going in that the rooms were compact but for someone that is staying more than one night I couldn't understand why you would put them in the smallest room? I have seen pics on their website and not all rooms are that small. There was barely room to put a suitcase down and manouver around with any ease or comfort. I found the actual room to be quite grubby. For some reason there was always dust on the floor in quite big clumps and I hate this new lazy thing hotels seem to be doing of just putting a sheet over a doona with no cover, it feels very unhygienic to me. When the room above me used their bathroom, a very high buzzing noise would echo throughout my room at any time of the day or night, at first I thought I was going crazy!! Also my room was right outside a door that was marked 'staff only', which apparently must have been some kind of garbage room as at 7am one morning someone was outside there rustling and crinkling plastic bags to within an inch of their life. Small issues yes, but as a collection they all contributed towards bad nights sleep in this hotel. Be warned, they do not have room service - if you order any food or drink you have to go down and pick it up yourself!! And if you want to store your luggage after check out they will charge you $7 for the privledge, either that or leave it for free in an unsecured corridor....The whole place just gives the impression that customer service is not their first priority. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the other ibis in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Fairycake58
Reviews.Content: On a recent holiday to Australia, we stayed at all Ibis hotels in Adelaide, Melbourne and Sydney. This one spoilt the last leg of the stay. The room was apparently a 'Queen'?Well, I'm glad I didn't bring my cat to swing round....We overlooked the huge office blocks and we could see them and they, us. The window was depressing in size, maybe 2 foot by 6 foot, with no view other than the office workers. The cleanliness was very poor, we were not hoovered for the whole 6 days! The manager was very patronising in manner, although other staff, more friendly. The only good point is that the location is good for the harbour, but I would advise paying more and staying at Darling harbour. My advice, if you're staying for one night, okay, more than that, find a park bench...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rroms, very,very clean”
Reviews.Author: Travellor69
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near King St Wharf then this hotel is great...I loved that the floors were not carpeted....the rooms are small but very functional. I can't believe I paid almost $300 for a night here - but that's what supply & demand is all about...! Would I stay again...? If I needed to be in this part of the city, then absolutely YES...!

Reviews.Title: “Handy city centre sleepover”
Reviews.Author: Beckham63Canberra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the city centre with several good coffee shops around the corner and wide variety of restaurants within five minutes walk on Kings Wharf. The rooms are small but very clean and quiet and adequate for a solo business overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: diddleydi
Reviews.Content: Ibis was a great base for our stay in Sydney, we were within walking distance of so many things and the staff on the front desk were very helpful. The room was compact but we were not in it much, and the shower was the best one of our whole trip. There is also an airport shuttle they can arrange for you for $14, wish we had known about this and not taken the smelly/dirty train from the airport for $15 - so bear this in mind if you are flying in and staying. Would definitely recommend if you just want somewhere clean, comfortable and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis King street wharf.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Good rooms, although I miss a comfortable seat where you can sit and read. Good value breakfast. Bit of a shock to have to pay to leave cases after checkout. I assume this is learned off the budget airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Freoshocker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located a short walk fron Wynyard Railway station so is easy to get to from the airport and a short walk from King Street Wharf, Darling Harbour and The Rocks. The hotel whilst basic (as you would expect from an Ibis hotel) is clean and a spacious bathroom. Breakfast is available, there is a limited bar but with numerous eateries nearby you are spoilt for choice for eating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly and very welcoming place to stay. All staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. Two streets back from the King Street Wharf and a direct route to the ferry station. Very convenient to the Darling Harbour precinct and the casino. An easy walk to the Rocks, Circular Quay and Opera House. Outside noise was not noticeable and the bed was comfortable.The price was very reasonable and represented good value for money as opposed to the outrageous prices at other establishments. We look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mundo61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights over the Xmas and New Year break. The location is great, very close (less than 200 metres) from everything Darling Harbour has to offer. The city centre is also close, well within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful, check-in and out were a breeze and they were happy to help out with any enquiry that we had. A fairly typical Ibis property, but the rooms including the bathroom were smaller than any I have encountered before, broom cupboard size. The cleaning of the room left alot to be desired, a coffee spill on the bedside table was still there 2 days later and was only cleaned cos we did it ourselves and the floors were often not cleaned. The sheets weren't changed for 6 days and we had to ask to get them changed for the last night. I found this disappointing as the daily charges for the room varied significantly. The first few nights Dec 26 - 29 were the standard rate of around $108.00/night, that price climbed to over $230.00 for the next night and to $480.00 for NYE and back down to $230.00 for the last night of our stay. For $480.00/night I expect clean sheets and a cleaned room. I rate the value as poor because of the price gouging over NYE

Reviews.Title: “Bridge Climb Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice motel in central location. Room was particularly small although clean and modern. Window was obscured by building next door but had two roller blinds which gave filtered light and no light- a novel idea. Parking our car was expensive, however we made use of the full 24 hours as we went shopping before checking out. Check out time was 11am which is a brilliant idea.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull at all time the room a bit small cleaning was avarage handy to most things and handy to the places I had to get too the bed a bit small may you should consider some king size beds as people over 6 foot hang over the edge overhall its nearly the same as Formula one but cheeper than Mercure wich is double the price in some instances

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: shar_mihir
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff. Small room is made up by helpful staff and awesome location next to Darling harbour... all major locations / offices at walkable distance. Breakfast is quite expensive though for its actual menu, hence didnt have any

Reviews.Title: “Compact and clean”
Reviews.Author: RockyDarwin
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small but clean. Love that they don't have carpet. Dining options in darling harbor close by. Service nothing special but just okay. Bit of traffic noise but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS!”
Reviews.Author: michelle n
Reviews.Content: my room was disgusting, there was dried up vomit on the bathroom door and crumbs under our bed, a bit of a walk from darling harbours main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “christmas party stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was modern and clean. How ever the breakfast was far from what I would expect especically the sausages which had a wite fatty substance ozz out when cutting them and it squirted over my clothing. After seeing both my self and Wife no longer felt hungrey. It was not advertised that it would cost an additional $40 for parking over night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location spoilt by shoe box size room”
Reviews.Author: ansh9899
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with family - wife and a teenage son. Good things first - the location is the best one can think of in Sydney. It is right at Darling Harbour, very close to Wynyard Railway station, walking distance to Opera House and Harbour Bridge, Curcular Quay and City Centre. The best locations that Sydney can offer, IBIS Shelley Street has that. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Many of our requests were complied with promptly. The check-in and check out was a breeze. The problem starts with the rooms.The rooms are very small size. The only choice for beds is Queen or single. The rooms are more like shoe boxes.The bathroom is pathetically small - so small that if you wish to scrub yourself and therefore move your hands in the process, you are most likely to get scratch marks on your elbows because they will invariably brush against the walls of the bathroom, it is so small !! The location is brilliant but is spoilt by a narrow slit of glass which is qualified as a window. You barely get to get one eye into the slit to see outside the room. The slit does only one purpose - it allows the light to waft into the room, making your sleep quality poor. Then we get down to breakfast. The charges for full breakfast at AUD 20.0 doesn't do any justice to breakfast spread. And to top it all, the charges for the room were AUD229.0 per night, which is astronomical by any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experiance”
Reviews.Author: keithNewcastle Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we ended up in the building next door. due to the only car park was available at that end of carpark.We were locked in that building for 20 minutes till security gard came allong and let us back into your building.He was not cranky with us but very cranky with IBIS as he said this had happened several times before. Room was very small and parking expensive $315:00 for this accomodation was far to expensive. Could have stayed at Wentworth for this ammount Not value for money. I have been an ACORR member for 11 years and certainly would not stay in that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ooh so convienient”
Reviews.Author: SAINT58 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated acouple of blocks to Central station ,block from Darling Harbour precinct and an easy walk to the city centre. Great staff and very helpful - suited to business travel Many coffee shops and eating establishments close by

Reviews.Title: “Sydeney and Perth Trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was a fantastic hotel location and the front desk staff couldn't have done more, especially Rob who was invaluable when it came to knowledge of the city. Furthermore he was a fantastically genuine and nice guy. Thanks to all the other staff too who were equally brilliant. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to stay if you are going on a harbour cruise, helpful and friendly staff. Parking a bit of a challenge, however subsidised parking was available across the road. Breakfast was good value especially if you belong to the advantage plus club. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,very clean small room,fair price”
Reviews.Author: dieuwke
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight hotel in Sydney while we were there,walked passed the hotel,liked the location and decided to stay.The room is small but contains everything you need and very quite.It is a great location close to everywhere by ferry or walking distance.They have a parking rate of $40 but the same carpark asks for $80 for 4 hrs,so it was a good deal afterall.The reception staff were very friendly .Definitly a good place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Clean and compact!”
Reviews.Author: Juno1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Septeber 2011, the rooms a tiny however they are clean and more modern then most. the breakfast is reasonable. This hotel is 5 mins from city centre and there is plenty of city information in the lobby. For the price of this hotel it is good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jordan-ashleigh Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great basic hotel in a convenient location to both Darling Harbour and the CBD. Breakfast was basic but was also affordable. Staff were very friendly. Would recommend if you just need some where to sleep- a great base to explore sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hotel King St Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff at this hotel. The Location was excellent for either shopping in the city or dining at Darling Harbour and close to alot of attractions like the Sydney aquarium. The rooms are not that big but very clean. We would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room and hotel was good great location and room was tidy and clean. would use this hotel again due to positioning and cost. Service was good and breakfast was nice plenty to offer the travelling business man or a traveller with not much to spend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy walk to Darling Harbour and just a step to the Aquarium and the Wild Life Park, we took a ferry to Circular Quay and the wharf was behind the hotel. They have a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Relatively new Ibis ,very small rooms,clean. Close to the Lime street bar precinct. Would be a squeeze with a couple and long stay luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, small room, OK for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: mdcwa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 10AM after a 14 and 1/2 hour flight from LAX. Check in time is 2PM, but our room was ready and we were allowed to check in. Dagmara at the front desk was very helpful and courteous. The room is small, about 15 by 10 feet. We had a queen bed, a small desk, and a closet about 2 feet wide. The bed was firm and comfortable. However, only about half of the closet can be used for hanging clothes as there was an ironing board in the closet and the other half was taken up by shelves. There was a refrigerator, luggage stand for one suitcase, and a safe in the room. The bathroom is about average size with a shower, but the sink is very small. Soap, shampoo and conditioner were provided. Two bath towels , one wash cloth and a bath mat were provided. We asked for hand towels and were told that they did not have them, and would send up a wash cloth and a bath towel. What arrived was a wash cloth and a bath mat. We booked this hotel because it was close to Barangaroo Wharf 5 Passenger Terminal for cruise ships (about a 10 minute walk to the terminal, but we used a cab which was out in front of the hotel-$10). For one night the room was OK, but for an extended stay the room would not be acceptable. The hotel is next to the Western Distributor Highway-about half the rooms face this highway. Road noise at night was not too bad, but increased as dawn approached. Wall are also thin as we heard our neighbor leave at 4:45 AM. The hotel is convenient to Darling Harbour and about 2 KM from Circular Quay. Full breakfast is $20 and a continental breakfast is $15. We opted not to use the hotel for breakfast. There are coffee shops in the area and there is a convenience store across the street (also has an ATM). Internet is available for a charge.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCALE - BUT DONT THE CARS REST?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis is a simple, friendly hotel in a great location, easy walking distance to all the major CBD attractions and a few minutes from the rail networks. The room was clean and comfortable and staff welcoming and helpful. Also, the suppply of information about Sydney services and attractions good. It was unfortunate that sleep was occasionally disturbed by passing heavy vehicles; a fact of life of major cities but annoying. The hotel may not suit a family but for the solo traveller or short-stay couple it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was within walking distance to the wharf where I was to board the cruise ship and it was also within walking distance of Darling Harbour and the city centre. Just a short walk to the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, functional rooms in a perfect location to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: globalfish
Reviews.Content: The room was compact but made good use of the space, It was quiet and clean (although the floor should be dry mopped every day as it gets dusty) and the bed was comfortable. It is sort of Ikea-chic. When I was planning my trip from home, I was worried it would be out of the way from the main sights, but the location is really fantastic. King Street Wharf has pubs and restaurants and is on Darling Harbour. The ferry to Manly and Sydney Harbour dock is a 1-minute walk from the hotel. The CBD is right there and you can walk to Sydney Harbour and the Rocks in 15-20 mins. There is world class shopping about 4 blocks away and Chinatown is about 15 minutes walk, too. Pros: Good value, clean, quiet, location Cons: WiFi not included and over-priced0

Reviews.Title: “Ibis King Street Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel each year at the end of the Dawn Princess World Cruise because it is within easy walk from the wharf - even when each of us is pulling 30kg of luggage. So we will continue to stay here since we can enjoy the Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “everything was awesome except . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Customer Service was Outstanding - they helped us with every query we had, recommended things to us, location was great - a short walk to sydneys cbd and darling harbour, meals were yummy - great on the go meals (ham and chicken filo I recommend :). The only thing we didnt like were the beds - but who doesnt like a bed that isnt there own. But everything else was awesome :) Loved the personal greeting on the tv :)

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED WITH THE ROOM SIZE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel was great, however the room size was very disapointing, hardly room enough for two people to exist, nil passage way via bed and bathroom, a view of the freeway guard rail was also a problem, the air conditioning was all over the shop and no room to sit without using the bed as a lounge, i am not trying to sound to crictical but i was very dissapointed with the stay, should you want to discuss this futher my number is [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mmij
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work trip. Very basic amenities but very clean and very close to great restaurants and transport. Room had a queen size bed, flat screen TV and a huge bathroom!! I would definately stay here again both for either work or pleasure. Is definately VERY good value for money especially in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable but room very small and basic. Reception staff very helpful. We stayed here to go to show at Theatre Royal it was about 10 min walk to theatre plenty of restaurants close by at Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was very convenient to walk to Darling Harbour - especially the night they had the fireworks! The staff were all very helpful & pleasant with all of our requests during the stay - loved the way they greated you each time you came in/went out of the hotel - so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The guy who took my call and answered questions on how to get there and parking and also checked us in showed great customer relationship skills. He even recommended places to dine where we could charge back to the Hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The location and price were excellent for proximity to Darling Harbour and Theatre Royal. Thank you for providing the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After many years as an Accor Advantage Plus member through my wife and individually, my expectations were definitely not met. No record of my booking, had to produce my copy of the confirming email. Dirty towel protruding from under bed. Breakfast wasn't ready at declared time. Requested payment when I had previously paid upon booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nirajay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Aug 2011 as a part of our Aussie trip. Location - The hotel is situated steps away from Darling harbour. with a 5 mins walk, you are at Ferry, Rail links. There's a bus stop just behind the hotel so transportation wise you cannot fault the place. If you love walking, then CBD area is <10 min walk. The shopping area, Town Hall, is less than 1km walk. Overall location wise, it's perfect. For the price, you cannot find a better hotel with equally good location. Hotel amenities / Staff - The hotel is perfect, though the room size can be slightly small. The staff are very attentive to your needs. Facilities wise they are great. Negatives - Only one - The only problem with the hotel is the fact that a whole day's internet costs AUD25 which doesn't make any sense. We live in an era where a month's broadband costs < Â£15 and it just doesn't make any sense to charge the same for a day's usage. However, this is a practice used by hotel chains all over the world so cannot single out Ibis alone for this. Overall, a great hotel with a great location. Surely can recommend this place for anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: girlfromOz25
Reviews.Content: I noted what previous reviewers had said about the size, but from doing research on location vs. cost decided to give the Ibis King St Wharf a go and I'm glad I did - my fiance and I had to travel to Sydney for a wedding and wanted to be near the venue but not pay an arm and a leg. Although the room didn't have much room, it had a huge comfortable bed, was very clean and have to reiterate how great the position was - only one block back from Darling Harbour and walking distance to the CBD, The Rocks etc. The staff were all courteous and friendly too. No complaints - great value for money. Our room didn't have a view, but again for the price I wasn't expecting much. It was surprisingly quiet given that it looked out over a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and sensibly priced. Clean and clever.”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: Once you accept that the Ibis King Street Wharf is designed for practical, sensibly-priced travel, it's easy to see the clever value of this hotel. The hotel is basic - don't expect luxuries like designer soaps or a pillow menu in this one. But you will find a reasonably comfortable bed, and very clean, modern interior. A significant benefit to this Ibis hotel compared with any others in the chain that I've stayed at, is that the hotel has been designed with a higher quality fit-out - the bathroom, in particular, is of a high quality standard, with proper ceramic basic, quiet, clean showers, and a toilet with a nice soft-closing lid. The TV system is first-rate, out-doing many of the dated systems you'll find in older 5 star hotels - the system includes all the expected movies, messages, and channels, but in a great HD interface that's responsive and well tuned. The rooms include a work desk with adequate space and connectivity. The food options are basic, but again they're adequate - some simple heated food is available for collection from reception 24 hours, and the cafe is open for breakfast, and offers a good value take-away option - where you can make yourself an espresso coffee and take a tray of food (yoghurt, toast, fruit etc). The parking is limited but has always been available when I've stayed here. The floors in the rooms are an easy-to-clean wood-finish laminate, and the bed is actually a mattress elevated from the floor on a floating wooden base - fairly unique for a hotel, but allows for easy cleaning - and I can't fault the cleanliness of the rooms. For those quick "bed and bath" business stays, this hotel is ideal - and it's located sensibly for CBD work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - recommend for singles and couples”
Reviews.Author: Duyfken
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, excellent bathroom, clean, each room has a safe which I was looking for. Parking costs $40 per day so make room for that in your budget. Ibis management listened to my mild criticisms and have fixed the problems. Eg. radios no good - Ibis replaced ALL the radios in every room. Lamp wouldn't go - replaced immediately. No wholemeal or multi-grain bread - couldn't fix immediately but took steps to ensure that it wouldn't happen again. Get the full breakfast - the $9.95 continental hardly worth it. Plenty of restaurants close by for dinner and lunch. However, they do have room service. Don't forget to organise with the motel your car parking before you leave to obtain the $40 a day or else you will be up for a bill for hundreds of dollars. The staff were friendly and responded immediately to any concerns. I would have preferred a better deal on the internet usage. Once you log out, you have to pay the $25 per day service again. However, the work desk was good and the bed was comfortable. I would recommend this for a single person or couple that would like a comfortable motel close to all attractions in the city and don't mind dining out.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a place I would want to return too!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought that the site could have told you, would need to pay for parking at this motel, the staff were helpful, polite, approachable, excellent in every way. I would have been very annoyed if I had actually paid the going rate for this motel, the accomodation has nothing to sell it dark brown fake wood floors, no view, windows look directly across into what looks like a call centre, so blinds up no privacy even from the 6th floor, I paid for the upgrade queen room which was squashy and tiny so I would really have hated to see what the basic was like, the online ad for this motel depicts it is on the water front not stuck behind another building, We had to pay to park at this site which is not advertised on the website for this motel and it wasn't even the motels own carpark it was a public parking station across the road which they had discount rates to allow motel patrons to use. I would have to say the hotel was the worst aesthetically I have been too yet.

Reviews.Title: “treat for my daughter and my self”
Reviews.Author: chunky51 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis hotel was very comfortable, staff were friendly , good for a night or two stay if you have got something on in the city, close to darling harbor ,restaurants hotels etc, they upgraded us to a king bed, which was great and had a great sleep as very quite, breakfast was a full buffet or continental if you like, served til 10:am, we would stay there again, great price too . lovely.

Reviews.Title: “everything is EXTRA..aud25 for internet! $40 for breakfast..clean but TINY”
Reviews.Author: r s
Reviews.Content: First the good; early check in was allowed as our flight came in and we were tired after a15 hour journey. room was clean and bed was comfortable, shower worked well. black out curtains and good sound insulation. Not so good: one small towel per person, no hand towel or flannel. shower was small, but the ROOM? it was TINY! one luggage rack for TWO people with a bag each=unsatisfactory. we are not large people but kept bumping into one another = unsatisfactory. Really dodgy? how about aud25 bucks for a day to use the internet on one's own laptop= unsatisfactory. $40bucks for cooked brekky for 2 is steep.went round the corner to a nice cafe for $12. Average rating because it's a great place to SLEEP.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Austravel25
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ibis for its convenient location to Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour, and we were not disappointed during our 2 night stay. The room was smallish, but was quiet, very clean and well presented. The bathroom was very clean and functional, and the privacy and blockout curtains are a good idea. There is parking on-site or just over the road, with reduced rates available through Ibis compared to the usual parking rates. Reception staff were smiling and helpful. The location is excellent, being close to several eateries and bars and a fairly easy 10 minute walk to all the activities in Darling Harbour. Close proximity to the King Street Wharf means a ferry ride only takes 20 minutes to Circular Quay and The Rocks. Certainly recommend the Ibis for a relatively low price stay in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieK131 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. The location is fantastic, restaurants at the doorstep. It is about 50m from a ferry terminal so getting around is easy. The rooms are a little on the small side but have everything you need in them. The service provided was excellent, the staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Venue location was great. This was an Accor free night so I guess I was given the cheapest room. Even for a budget room (211), the room size size was small. The TV location was a joke it couldn't be turned tyoward the bed it faced the side wall. The breakfast was over priced for what was available, even though could eat as much as you wanted. Staff interaction was good. I will tell friends what I found. Regards Mick Fogarty

Reviews.Title: “Sore Backs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good. The cleanliness of the room was good. What we had a issue with was that the size of the room was extremely small, the bed was so uncomfortable that we were waking up with backaches every morning from sleeping on a wooden base, & you couldn't get pressure from the shower nozzle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantasic location, the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was complimentary however considering that it was just right for our needs. We will stay again and recommend it to our friends. Food was plentiful and atmosphere in dinning area was comfortable with seating variations.

Reviews.Title: “Two different rooms, two very good stays.”
Reviews.Author: Stinz3
Reviews.Content: We had two stays in this hotel, at the beginning and end of our Australian trip. The fact that we went back to this hotel speaks volumes about how good it is. Despite all the wonderful things I am about to say, I will make one disclaimer: this hotel is located next to a highway. On our first stay we got room 514, which faces the highway. The room has a double-paned window, which severely reduced the noise coming from the road, but the truth is that we could still hear the occasional heavy truck and motorcycle. That being said, as heavy sleepers we still had two good nights of sleep and were impressed enough that we booked a room for our subsequent visit to Sydney. For our second stay, we got room 305 which was away from the highway and this just made our experience even more brilliant. In this room we did not hear any noise from outside. If you are a light sleeper, you should insist on a room away from the highway. That being clarified, this hotel is fantastic on all levels: The staff was kind, efficient and clearly had a commitment to excellence. The room was comfortable, clean, well appointed, well lit, comfy queen bed, desk, small sofa, nice bathroom with ample shelf space and good water pressureâ€¦and had awesome â€œblack-outâ€� blinds that made the room completely black at night. However, you have to pay for internet access. The room service menu is very good and affordable; however the breakfast was a little expensive (there are plenty of affordable cafÃ©s in the area). The location is fantastic. Steps from Darling harbour with its cafÃ©s, restaurant and shops. You are a 10 minute walk to The Rocks, there is a ferry stop (that goes to/from Circular Quay) steps from the hotel and the train that goes to the airport is only 3 blocks away. The rooms aren't huge but aren't tiny either, itâ€™s got a bit of a business hotel feel lacking a little warmth, and if they offered better towels and free wi-fi that would put them over the top. Overall, the quality of this hotel, its magnificent location and its reasonable price trumps the small items I mentioned and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a well priced basic room.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_from_Canberra
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were friendly, professional and very helpful when called upon. Rooms were basic but everything worked and was in good to excellent condition. Bed and bedding were moderately comfortable. Parking is well lit and secure. Wi-Fi was readily available throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Basic Room at a Great Price with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic. Rooms where basic, but served their purpose well (carpet would have been preferred over the mock hard wood floor). Bed was firm and comfortable to sleep on, but it felt like a double bed when i had booked a queen. Great range for breakfast, but was a little cold when i ate it at 7:30am. Overall a good, clean hotel that is great if you just need a bed to sleep in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was very limited and was not fresh. The receptionist was not very helpful with no communication or customer service skills. We booked a superior room; it was very small and nothing special; very ordinary

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, New Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sparky2509
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our vacation. Got a good cheap rate online and found the hotel to be quite new and very clean. Were helped out with a very early check-in after a long flight so was happy with the accomodating staff. Only critisism was the cost of a beer, well overpriced! Good location, great staff, if you can get a good rate then I reccomend this hotel....but drink somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Thank :)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was great & we enjoyed our stay it was rather handy for us as we were getting on a cruise at the wharf so it was great to be so close. The staff were great and very helpful. We arrived before normal checkin time and it was fantastic to be able to get our room early.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location It's just a step away from one of the best location in Sydney. Right on darling Habourside,where everything is just a step away. Lovers, family, and friend would find something to do there. Ibis hotel was very pleasant ,clean and comfortable to stay in. I would go back time and time again. The staff were very helpful in helping you to get around Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Ibis Kingswarf I was initially disappointed when directions to the parking area ,lift and acess to my room was not clearly explained ,the result being an approximate 250 meter walk with all my luggage back to reception, the check in and pleastiness of the staff was more than acceptable with the staff explaining in detail our location and nearby establishements of interest,my dissapointment came when I accessed my room which was so small that it was not possible to be in the room apart from sleeping,luggage space was virtually non existant and there was no room to sit comfortably and complete any work or notes that you may like to complete,an extremely small window was the only outside view which overlooked the up ramp to the Harbour Bridge approximately 8 meters from my window.Had this been explained or detailed on the Hotel's website then this may be accepatable but in my opinion the website was not a true indication of the Hotel's accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “small but effective”
Reviews.Author: jojozwp
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the ibis for 4 nights recently pre cruise with friends. The hotel was chosen based on location (darling harbor, 10 min walk to CBD and access to P&O cruise dock). Price was also a big factor. The rooms are very small, but we had no intention of spending a lot of time looking at 4 walls. The amenities of the hotel are limited, but with such a vast selection of bars, cafes and restraunts on your door step, this was not an issue. The rooms although small, were very clean and quiet. The friendly staff at the Ibis were more than helpful especially Brendan, who went out of his way to make us feel welcome and accomodate our requests. If you want luxury, or spend lots of time in hotel rooms, this probably wouldn't suit, but for location, price and friendly staff you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “good to stay at Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: overall, it was good, and the location is convenient. the room is a bit small compare to other hotel with the same rate. such as holiday inn. the bathroom is not very clean. I saw some hairs on the ground when I first enterd the room. the bed is not really comfortable. service is very good, staff are keen on help with any request.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Sydney King St Wharf May 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, good value, very good service, clean & presentable. The rooms are smallish but ok for a single traveller. The reception & office staff were very helpful. Breakfast options were good and the small bar handy. AG

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: dawnio16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and both mornings I woke up bitten on the ankles after sleeping in the bed. The room was very small and also quite dirty. On the plus side the reception staff were really helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ideal position in Darling Harbour with easy access to and from it and is located close to many of the attractions throughout Darling Harbour. The staff were very friendly and assisted with my special requests without hesitation. i have stayed here a couple of times now and will defintiely be coming back. the overall experience is very pleasant and i feel very comfortable staying here. some places make you feel like you don't belong there, but not this place.

Reviews.Title: “The other IBIS Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but quite fresh and new. Finally an IBIS where the powerpoint is somewhere near the bed (sort of) Good location right between Darling Harbour and the city. Will definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived friday afternoon and conveniently parked in front of the hotel and got directions to the car park which was a little hard to find as the entrance was around the back.We booked in and the staff were very helpful and obliging.While my wife and our friends were settling in I took a walk to Martin Place to do some business. Saturday morning we had a lovely breakfast at the hotel and then walked to the markets at the Rocks.After spending a few hours at the market we walked to Circular Quay and caught a ferry to Manly where we had lunch.We spend the late afternoon in Darling Harbour shopping and enjoing the scenery. The position of the Ibis is perfect as you can see by the above that it is walking distance to everything that you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Magic1121
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel in April 2011. Service: Excellent! Front-desk girls are always ready to help more than you request. If you have any serious issues, please sort out before night shift as night shift team is not effective as morning team. Room: tiny but clean. It is so good for one person to stay. Two people will reduce the comfort but if you spend most of day outside, it is not a big issue. Water pressure for shower is the best I have ever known. You need to bring you own body wash if you do not mind to use soap. Location: Fantastic! One minute to King St Wharfâ€™s restaurants and bars. The must-do things, such as, City sightseeing Sydney & Bondi: bus stop on the left corner of hotel; Captain Cook Cruisesâ€™ stop is very near from hotel for night sightseeing and gold dinner; 10 minutes to Sydney Aquarium; 5-10 minutes to Sydney Tower & Skywalk; 15-20 minutes to Sydney Harbour Bridge climb; 15-20 minutes to central station; 5 minutes to George Street for shopping. The location of this hotel is 5-star. Food: I only tried the buffet breakfast. Good but not impressive as expected. Just normal food you would have everyday in your living place. I mean if you are a real tourist, you would like to try different food but not the food you can find in your kitchen. To be honest, this Hotel is really good and I would like to recommend it to my friends and family if they travel to Sydney for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at the Ibis excellent. Check in was dealt with quickly and efficiently. We were a bit disappointed with the size of the room and it's bathroom. It looked bigger in the advertising. However the room was clean and fresh and looked newly appointed. Which upon enquiry I learnt that this Ibis was only about 2 years old. We ate breakfast at the hotel, it was well presented and substantial. The position of the hotel was excellent and was a prime contributor to our choice of where to stay while in sydney. The bed was perhaps a little hard for our liking but everyone is different in this respect and you can only aim to please the majority, you will never satisfy everyone. Given that we were using accor free nights it was definitely value for money, but if i was paying i would perhaps think that given the size of the room it wasn't value but then given position that is worth alot, it is difficult to make a judgement here. Overall other than the size of the room we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid priced motel for sydney, if you are going to Darling Harbour. The king St Dining precinct is high quality. The location is a short walk to trains and ferry's. Darling Harbour offers great walks around the area. the rooms for quite and modest, the breakfast area was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great "little" hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP724
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I wasn't travelling with the children this time, as the rooms are very small. The bathroom was also small with nowhere to put your clean clothes (except on the floor) and it's surprising there was no extractor fan (but there is another mirror in the room if the bathroom one is too steamed up for applying make-up). Having said that, I couldn't fault the service and everything was very clean. We didn't spend much time in our rooms anyway (too busy sightseeing) so the size wasn't really an issue. I'm glad we arrived by shuttle bus though, as parking outside the hotel (to check-in) would be next to impossible, with busy traffic lights right outside. Apart from that, the location of the hotel was excellent; a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour, shops, restaurants etc. Easy access to public transport. A Seven/11 convenience store over the road. Breakfast prices add up (as they do anywhere else): $15 continental, $20 cooked, and an express takeaway at $9.50 an option. This is where the hotel excelled - the room was exceptionally clean and there was a good choice to suit everyone, well laid out and labelled. The service from the chef (who appeared to be working by himself) was outstanding; if you got stuck trying to work out the coffee machine for instance, he was there in a flash. We weren't planning on eating breakfast here every day (because of the cost), but ended up doing so, because it was convenient and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at your ibis hotel at King street warf Sydney. i was very dissapointed with my stay here. i booked using an accor girft card i had received and was charged $300 for one night for my room. We also had friends stay in this same hotel who also booked through accor and were only charged $170 for the exact same quality of room and on a higher level. i think it is awful that i was charged so muchh extra just because i had a gift card where in reality you were still paid the full amount of $300 there was no discount for you. We stayed at another Sydney hotel the night before which was 5 star and we only paid $245 which included car parking and an upgrade, along with breakfast. I would have had no problem paying the higher amount at you hotel if i had recieved a much better room then my friends but this was definately not the case. i will not be staying with accor in the future. Nichol

Reviews.Title: “Ibis King Street Wharf "forgettable" accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The photos on the website don't show true size of rooms. We were in a shoe box overlooking the underneath of a car overpass. The filter/air conditioning vent above the toilet was so filthy you could not see through the holes. The bathroom had a sign in it to keep the door shut when having a shower as the steam will set off room smoke alarm. - no exhaust fan in the room. We wanted a late night drink and the chap kept trying to upsell 2 drinks for my hubby not just the one we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the doorstep of Darling Harbour, which is awesome. On arrival we headed down for a Jet Boat ride, got back saturated so the closeness of the hotel was appreciated for a quick change of clothes. The location was perfect for us as we were doing the Harbour Bridge Climb the next morning, that was a 20 minute walk. The room was spotless and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and very acceptable”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: This Ibis is close to Darling Harbour and very convenient for access to public transport -including 5mins to the ferries. Also many attractions around the harbour are walking distance. My room was nice, clean comfortable. There was a room safe, but it was a small box on the floor at the end of the sofa and difficult to reach. Alicia and Nikki were very helpful staff, with planning my trips and departure arrangements. There is a breakfast room, but no other meals. But you are only 5 mins walk to Kings Wharf which has bars & restaurants, and 10 mins further to Darling Harbourside which has a good selection. My only problem was with my departure arrangements. I had a late night flight, but had to check out by midday and could not stay in the room as the hotel was full that night. I investigate the lockers in the basement. They are stacked 3 high and the computer decides which one you get. No way could I lift my suitcase that height to level 2 or 3. Lockers cost $7 for the day and $1 each time you open the door. I left my luggage in the corridor near reception. But the hotel does not have any shower or changing rooms either. I feel that hotels in a city with an international airport should make provision for guests who have late night flights. Nevertheless, this was a lovely hotel, with helpful front desk staff and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...”
Reviews.Author: padgoj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at "The Ibis" for 4 nights in Feb and found the hotel perfect in every way, we booked in with no problems and had a nice room on the 6th floor, yes the rooms may be small but we found this no problem. We had a full English breakfast every morning which was very nice. All the hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeable, we had a problem with the safe in our room and it was sorted out with in 15 mins. The position of the hotel is with in walking distance of all Sydney's sites and great restaurants. The hotel arranged an airport shuttle bus to take us back to the airport $14 each, we also stored our 2 large cases in the hotel lockers $7. We had no problems with this hotel and for the price we paid we would certainly come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “No quilt covers used”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have found with the two IBIS hotels i have stayed in in Sydney and Melbourne - both do not use quilt covers. The room smelt of mould but was clean in appearance. Shower amenities were clean also. Bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kman45
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good, only negative is the room size. If your on a quick business trip, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Night In Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Met with a smile that went through the whole experience. Please make sure that your find out that parking is available (and it is) and all will be OK. The room is decent for the stay I was envisaging (a single night) but could be OK for a few more nights. Close to the CBD and a walk to Sydney's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A new Ibis in sydney is very good.”
Reviews.Author: debstant
Reviews.Content: The newest Ibis Hotel in Sydney very good at the usual ibis standard. very handy location to the city. enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Clean tiny rooms, good location, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterGal56
Reviews.Content: Problem: Upon my arrival at the hotel my private room was not ready for me as the hotel had given away my room to another traveler without my prior consent. While I was able to use the room that night, I was unable to do so when I needed it or wanted it after my 22 hour flight from NY to Sydney. Very unprofessional. Since the hotel was sold-out, the only thing the hotel could offer me was for me to change my clothes in the hotel's public bathroom!. Hardly the treatment I expected with a prior reservarion. This was totally unacceptable but I had to make due.

Reviews.Title: “major problems with Accor pre-booking”
Reviews.Author: MikeT2000
Reviews.Content: I had prebooked 3 rooms and prepaid via my Accor Advantage membership.The Hotel refused to accept the validity of my prepaid booking and I had to pay for 2 extra nights that were bonus nights with my booking. For 30 minutes they argued that I had not prepaid for the breakfasts inspite of my having a printed receipt from Accor.They said Accor make many mistakes(they have never in my long experience).The whole check in took forever as every point was argued. This hotel should not be part of the Accor group. The hotel is well located ,but rooms the smallest I have ever experienced and those on the motorway side(about 2m away) were noisy. I would never never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Holiday at King Street Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very well situated. Very clean and compact. Great for families with teens. Very nice breaky. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “convienient & excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: well located for both business and liesure excellent restraunts close by and walking distance to shops and many attractions

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glas166
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and was quite happy with the stay. The location is excellent for central Sydney and Darling Harbour. The hotel is economy so you dont get the added frills and services of other more expensive places. Our room, although small was all we needed this weekend, it was clean and quiet and provided good value. This is the first time I have stayed here, and would do it again for a similar type weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis King Street Wharf Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was great, staff helpful, very clean, room was a little on small size would be perfect for a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Sail away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was great. It is a short walk from Darling Harbour and wonderful restaurants. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Night in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff in a central location to Darling Harbour and the Rocks. Room small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an over-night stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Australia_11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Kings Street Wharf Ibis provides good rooms at reasonable prices. On the downside, it seemed to be short-staffed on the day we checked-in as the process took over an hour. Also for Sydney-siders planning on driving into the city, the parking is located down the street, which is good value but would prove a problem for ppl with lots of luggage. The location is good - just wear sensible shoes if planning to walk down to the Harbour. The hotel to Pyrmont Bridge/Darling Habrour is about 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a 1st timer in Sydney I didn't lnow what to expect. I found the hotel more than met my expectations & I will certainly rebook if returning to Sydney and recommend it to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated dog boxes”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are no more than over rated, over inflated, dog boxes. We woke the next morning to find that we had just slept with a doona covered in red and yellow stains. The reason that we did not see that before going to sleep was because it had been conveniently laid with the stains face down. Also, the Ibis has limited parking. We were required to find parking at a different location. I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS HOLE! And I USED to be an Accor member. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Some improvement opportunities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Shower door did not close properly and water on the floor was an issue especially considering there was no bath mat provided. Good location but would have liked a few extras for the $ spent - will most likely stay at the Mercurie Broadway as opposed to the Ibis next time as they have a pool and gym for the same value. Reception very courteous, brekfast room small and impersonal but servcie and food OK Not too bad overall perhaps location to Darling Harbour tends to make hotel attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay very much. Very convenient location

Reviews.Title: “excellent beginning to a wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the service, the cleanliness of the rooms, the convenient location as we dined at Darling Harbour.Thank you also for the 5% discount towards our dinner at Nick's Seafood. We will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends and we will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, and resonable priced”
Reviews.Author: werli Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the world at the Ibis King Street Whart. But expect regular Ibis quality = nothing fancy, but a good bed to sleep and whatever else you can expect from a discount hotel chain. On top of this you get an excellent location 5min walk from Darling harbour and 15min to the Opera house. So if you don't plan on spending to much time at the hotel, and most of the time in the city, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis King Street Wharf no frills”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis King Street Wharf doesn't disappoint! For an easy in, easy out, no frills stay, it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Need to Clean Up Your Act”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAdventurers2
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but this was expected from reading other reviews and was not a problem. It has a good location and was fairly quiet. However, the room itself was very dirty. We had prepaid for 5 nights, otherwise we would have left after one night. Our socks were filthy from walking on the floors, who knows when they were last cleaned and definitely don't look too close in any of the corners, etc.- something might be living in the dirt. The bed linen did appear to be quite clean and although it was to be changed every day unless you told them otherwise, I had to leave a note on the bed pillow after the third night requesting the linen to be changed. The hotel does have some pluses - Too bad someone isn't supervising the cleaning a bit more closely.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - rude staff at check-in”
Reviews.Author: AussieBumsSydney
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for a Birthday. Stayed at the Ibis King Street Wharf. The rooms were tiny and you had to be the size of a jockey to have a shower. Our room faced the on ramp to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Very little sleep due to the noise from passing trucks and cars. Breakfast was lovely and service in the eatery was great. The staff at check-in were very rude. The two staff were talking about what they were going to do over the weekend and had to wait to be served. I have never checked-in at a hotel and not spoken too - not even a hello & good bye

Reviews.Title: “Small but great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTex
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Qantas Holidays as a two-night package, but added a night. If we had booked the third night not with Qantas we would have no doubt gotten it cheaper, but nevermind. Patrick checked us in and made us feel very welcome. We parked in the garage next door and accessible to/from the hotel by elevator - very painless ($30/night). The room was not roomy, but served our purpose. It was clean and modern, and even though our window faced a busy street, the windows were thick and kept out the noise. Our package included breakfast on the Sydney Harbour Bridge with the breakfast provided by the hotel. We were overloaded with food - muffins, croissants, fruit, a baguette, smoked salmon, yoghurt, juice, milk, and small meat pies. Alicia at the desk spent quite a while trying to help us find a laudromat that was open on a Sunday to no avail, but it was not due to a lack of trying. And we could check email for $2 for 20 minutes. No complints. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Nitmare of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: losilosivale
Reviews.Content: Booked through a travel agent. This place was misrepresented by picturesque photos of Darling Harbour and the travel agent (Flight Centre) personnel. The worse nigtmare was dealing with the manager that was not helpful at all. Five times I have to confront him with the issue over the room and it wasn't till 1am in the morning he came to the party; thats when I couldn't find a nearby hotel to move to as they were all full. The room I was given was at the rear end of the hotel, precisely too small to move around, and only half a metre from the edge of the highway - making a lot of noise with the passing traffic. Yes, i was finally moved to a better room at after 1am in the morning. My main complaint was the issue of the room was not dealt with at the time. I was constantly ignored even I offered to pay more if that is reqired to rectify the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Looked a lot better in the ad-very small-misrepresented location”
Reviews.Author: MarkF54
Reviews.Content: Quote from ad, "Hotel Ibis, enjoying pride of place on the waterfront." Well it's not on the waterfront, it's back a block. The ad has pictures of big wonderful big rooms which is misleading, they are the smallest rooms I have every stayed in. They also say it's a vibrant hotel, again not true, it was very boring. In truth the the rooms are small, clean, OK front desk service and the location of the hotel is handy. If you are after a room NEAR King Street wharf this one is OK but only if you go there to sleep. Don't pay top dollar, it's not worth it. I would only stay here again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: MLANT
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 10 am after a long flight. A friend of mine passed by the hotel the day before and was confirmed my room would be ready however I was told it was not. The receptionist was very cold and just told me to come back after 2 pm. I told her that I was confirmed a room but she ignored and did not double check. I went to my friend office to wait and asked his staff to call the hotel to let us know when the room would be ready and the hotel said the room was ready... Very bad start! Rooms are what you would expect from an Ibis, clean, small but well designed. There are big discrepencies in the staff attitude and service mind, Some are welcoming and nice but others are very cold. The breakfast is quite good. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thenorage
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel very near Darling habour and 20 minute walk to the Rocks. Rooms very clean and new at the time of our stay. Stall friendly and keen to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANNGC
Reviews.Content: For a hotel of 3 / 4 stars is great. It's new, has been recently remodeled. The price is appropriate. It is well located (near the Darling Harbour). The internet is not free. The employees are very friendly. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Location is great. Right next to King Street Wharf. 5 mins from Wynward Station. Rooms were clean and modern but tiny (i did expect it to be small). There was barely enough space for 2 of us and 2 cases! Bathroom a nice size and modern. There was a big highway going past the hotel but it was well sound proofed as I didn't hear any traffic at all. The staff were always friendly and helpful. There is a bar/cafe where you can get breakfast/drinks but we didn't use it so I cant comment on that. NEGATIVE: On the morning we were leaving we wore woken but someone knocking doors (over and over agin) and shouting "houskeeping". It was 8.15 AM!....... This went on for over an hour. If i had the energy to get out of my bed I would have went out and told him to shut up............ I appreciate that rooms need cleaned but at this time in the morning staff should be quiet. We could hear the hoover scraping over the wooden floors and there was a big bang as he put down the mop bucket in every room........ This meant that we were then knackered as we were flying through the night to Hong Kong. I could have done with the extra 2 hours sleep that I didn't get. Also, $7 to keep your bag for a few hours is quite mean. Would I stay here again, I'm not sure. Maybe if we had a much larger room and gagged the housekeeper!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tr1ppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simple, it has few (read NO) extra features, the rooms are small and clean, the beds are well made, the air conditioning works, water pressure is good. I must admit I was a little disappointed when we first walked into the room...mostly due to its size, however, it's convenient location made up for the initial lack of enthusiasm I had for the hotel. Booked the hotel online as part of a package deal (flights/accom) and paid a very reasonable price, so all in all, I would say that I am a satisfied customer There is a 24 hour mini-mart store and a bottle store across the road. Couple of minutes walk to Wynyard Station Did not have breakkie there - the cafe next door was better value and had great pastries and coffee. We wanted to eat in on our last night..the room literature advised that food could be ordered and the picked up from the reception...what we did not find out till we tried to order is that it is essentially dial-a-pizza from an outside provider. It was good pizza, though it did take an hour to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: GillnBuck
Reviews.Content: Having pre-booked the Ibis some time back for $130 a night we really did get value for money. The Hotel is very central to everything from, walking to the Botonic gardens to the waterfront & the Opera House, Kings Wharf & Darling Harbour. Even the Tour Bus stops outside more or less. Rooms are modern (quite well thought out in design) and clean with drink facilities & fridge. Slightly more spacious than what we thought they would be and the staff were friendly, helpful if requiring any information, always happy to keep you topped up with tea bags too. Car parking was $30 per night but this is very resonable for city centre parking. Finding the car park entrance was a bit tricky , a shared underground car park with no signs as such but again, the staff will guide you in. My only slight moan was....there are no towel hooks in the bathroom. Other than the small towel rail left of the sink, there was no where to hang, towels or a dressing gown. Just a minor detail?

Reviews.Title: “Very handy to wharf if boarding cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: CyndySue18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night before we boarded the cruise ship. It is conveniently located to the wharf with a short walk of 100 metres. Also very close to Sydney city where you can walk into town. Room was clean and tidy but very small. No outlook except into office buildings, but it suited us for the position. If I was boarding a cruise ship, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Staff were helpful when asked questions. Lots of restaurants in close vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: smithNewZealand
Reviews.Content: my husbabd and i had three nights stay at the Ibis sydney street Wharf motel. we arrived to find a very helpful giril on the desk that was very nice and helpful her name was Alicia i must say that everyone that we came across who worked there was very good at their job even the young guy who was on the desk at 6 oclock when we checked out on the sunday the 9th of may sorry i forgot his named. we felt very welcomed to be a guest staying there. The Room was so very clean the first night we had a standard room and it was bigger enought for the two of us we were planing to be out all day sight seeing and shopping anyway we were on the 5th floor over looking the road and it was very quite which was quite amazing for been near the road. the next two night we were able to up grade to a bigger room for it had it on our ticket stating we could it was good too it was much bigger with a couch to be able to sit on instead of sitting on the bed. the floors were wood but it didnt make it cold the service was good we got up and left our bed unmade and when we return the bed was made and the pyjamers were neatly folded up on the bed i have never come across that in any other place we have stayed well done and thanks to the person who did it ,it made us feel pampered. Ibis is close to every thing you want to go to the Aquarium,Darling harbour,Star city casino restaurants and Bars shopping its all in walking distant the transport system is great you dont need a car when staying at Ibis you can get all day passes that have the buses trains and ferrys all on it. that you just get on one and get off and catch another form be it a bus, train of ferry . we will be definitely staying at Ibis Sydney king street again when we come back to Sydney thank you we had a great time .

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Ritz but top marks for great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Tavare
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the reviews of the Ibis mentioning that the rooms are small. That's what Ibis hotels provide...what do they expect, a 60 sq metre suite? I've stayed at many Ibis hotels around the world and they are much the same - compact rooms but with everything you need, good locations and good value rates. That's what you get at an Ibis, if you want big rooms and fancy services go to the Hilton and pay three times as much. I find it quite incredible how naive some travellers can be. If you want fancy, you pay for fancy. I booked my brother and his children into the Ibis for three nights and joined them for one of them. My wife and I were upgraded to a King harbour view because we are Advantage Plus members but it was still basically a slightly more fancy Ibis room. The important thing, though, was that it was new and clean, had a great bed, flat screen TV, and just about everything we needed (internet, ironing board, tea/coffee etc) and had very friendly staff. We got one of the best locations in Sydney for under $150 for the night. Up the road at the Hilton I would have paid $350 and it's nowhere near as good a base for a holiday as the Ibis.
