Instead we used the money we saved to have a great meal at Eleven on King Street Wharf, take a harbour cruise on the Magistic and visit Sydney Wildlife World. Everything was less than five minutes walk from the Ibis. Yes, it wasn't the Ritz, but I didn't book the Ritz, I booked the Ibis!

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you get an advance booking internet rate”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in May - booking online a month in advance the room was $116 per night and hot breakfast $20 per day (the rate increases if booking less than 30 days in advance as it was much more expensive when a colleague enquired). My room was on the Eastern side of the hotel on the 5th floor, and was similarly furnished to other Ibis' I have stayed in (i.e. rather austere) and very clean. One "surprise" was that instead of carpet the floor in the room had a wood grain style vinyl. The bed was comfortable, and the double blinds very effective at keeping the room dark in the morning. I note other contributors have commented on the breakfast. I thought $20 was reasonable for the hot breakfast, which included baked beans, bacon, scrambled egg, breakfast sausages, hash browns and mushrooms, but $15 for the continental breakfast selections is a bit steep. As other contributors have noted the hotel is a short walk to Darling Harbour, Wynyard and Circular Quay. I noted the hotel were advertising airport transfers for $12 and hire lockers for $7 per day, although I didn't use either facilitiy. The only problem I encountered was that the morning check out was a little slow as they only had one staff member on the desk and they were also handling telephone enquiries. Overall I consider that Ibis King Street represents excellent value for money if you get an advance booking internet rate. TC

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here”
Reviews.Author: MigueAngel
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, as small than you can barely open your cases. Besides a highway so expect just noisy nights. Everything is charged, a simple bottle of water, to keep your luggage the day you leave, parking, late checkouts, internet, they overcharge the breakfast,...everything overpriced. They don't let you even take a shower the day you leave after being wandering through Sydney the whole day, they don't mind even after you spent a lot of money at the hotel. False fire alarm in the middle of the night making all wake up and nothing in return, not even an apology. They don't care customers, they just make cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel close to darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: baalamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Ibis King St Wharf for 2 nights. Originally booked a superior room but on check in was upgraded to a king harbour room. These rooms are bigger than the standard rooms & have a partial view of the water so the space was adequate for our needs (2 adults & a 3yr old) even with a rollaway in the room. King size zip bed (breaks into a twin) was fine but the problem always with these zip beds is the zip in the middle being not very comfortable should you roll onto it -this is a fairly common thing in hotels though and I just wish hotels would invest in some matress toppers which would alleviate this issue. Being a newer hotel everything is still fairly fresh, bathroom does the job, shower cubicle is small but water pressure & heat are good. Air con worked really well and was adjustable in room. The hotel is in a good location to easily walk to all the restaurants of King St Wharf and probably a 5-10 minute stroll along the water to cockle bay wharf/darling harbour main area and monorail station, so this gives you pretty easy access to the city. The hotel has wooden floors which though they look good do allow noise from above rooms to travel easier. Found the staff to be friendly and professional on check in/check out. Parking at the hotel or at their offsite carpark is $30 a day -something that seems fairly common for hotel parking in sydney, so if you want to save some money do your homework, on the weekend you can park at the cockle bay wharf wilson carpark for $9 day -you will have to walk further but if you want to save some $ then worth having a look at the surrounding carparks for their rates. All in all our stay was good and if you are after a newer hotel room with the basics then this is a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, loc......”
Reviews.Author: JacquiKay
Reviews.Content: yes the rooms are small but the bathrooms were quite ample. we had no view but we didn't stay in our room very long anyway. we were able to get our room early but they have storage lockers for luggage if you cannot check in when you arrive. the staff was very cooperative. we were in walking distance of the harbor and the many fine restaurants. we were near a metro stop but never used it as we walked everywhere. the bon bon cafe a few doors down has great coffee and free wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Like the Pictures, Only Smaller”
Reviews.Author: Blackbirds
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Ibis. The rooms are clean but very small, definitely not for families. The service of the staff depends on who you get. The hotel is nearby many Darling Harbour restaurants but most of them are on the pricey end. Public transportation is not easily accessed. Internet costs are $10 per day if you get the weekly plan. The bus transfer stations are at least 5 hilly blocks away so you end up walking a lot. Overall, it met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: weeclairey
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location, just a 2 minute walk to darling harbour. As per some of the other reviews, the hotel rooms are not that big, but hey, you don't go all the way to oz just to sit in a hotel. Didn't have any breakfast as there were other cheaper cafe's etc near by. Again, no free wi-fi access, just like most hotels in oz, however there is a internet station just next to reception which is cheaper than the one you have in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed like family”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVibes
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Ibis, King Street Wharf 3 or maybe 4 times now. Staff are so friendly that they greet us as if we were family or friends. They chat with us, recalling previous conversations yet they never relax on professionalism, such as when phoned at 2am about the aircon (yes it is noisy and a little difficult to set just right) they clearly explain how to set it; when asked for directions or help with deciding transport options to the airport or how to get right out of town to Glenmore Park (near Penrith) they are quick to help. Sydney has very expensive hotels with poor service from our experience and Ibis is like a "breath of fresh air". Our four nights stay from 30th Jan seemed expensive but was priced less than other comparable hotels. Welcoming, quiet, safe, clean,great location, helpful staff, what more can anyone want? The staff are human enough that sometimes things don't go according to plan i.e a forgotten towel or pillow and I much prefer this to the stuffy proper-ness of some other establishments. We didn't eat breakfasts as although these are inexpensive we found them lacking in variety (no gluten free and no muesli on a previous stay) but there's a cafe next door and a 24hour store across the road, and of course so many restaurants on Darling Harbour. For good food that's less expensive than most we recommend Wagamama (on same street as hotel). Our sincere thanks to Ibis King Street Wharf. We will stay with you again but as our son has now moved to Sydney we'll stay with him sometimes. Did I mention we were upgraded to a superior room on this visit! Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, but service is awful”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutCatlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel two separate times - at the beginning and end of a cruise. The hotel is clean and very well situated to the Aquarium and the wharf area. The rooms are small, beds comfortable and have basic bathroom amenities. My main complaint is the lack of service and the less than warm reception we received. Our friends asked for more pillows. They were told they would be right up with them - they were never delivered. Our TV was not working. We told reception on our way out in the morning. We were told they would have someone up to fix it while we were out for they day. No one ever came to look at it. We prepaid our stay to secure the internet price. When we were checking out, we were told that we had not paid. Even after showing them the computer print out we made of the transaction, they insisted "their records" did not show that we had pre-paid. I would recommend bringing the copy of the credit card statement with you to prove that you have paid. We had to pay them again and take care of the double charge with our credit card company when we got home. FYI on internet use - there is a charge of $11/hr if you use your computer in the room. There are 2 computers in the lobby that charge $2 for 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Overprized. Hotel charges an extra fee when paying with credit card. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: damaAMSTERDAM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very expensive considering the size of the rooms and the fact that everything extra (e.g. internet) will cost you a lot of money. Even paying cost you money as there is a surcharge for credit card payments!!! This is ridiculous for a hotel from a chain like Accor. Front desk staff is clumsy and not well informed. Due to bad advise of the front desk in connection with the airport pick up service we arrived 2,5 hours before departure at the airport (in the very early morning!) instead of 1 hour (which is required for domestic flights). Never again. Sydney offers much better (and cheaper) options.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but perfect for a cheap night”
Reviews.Author: ShellsO
Reviews.Content: These rooms are very small, and the window even more so. HOWEVER, if you are after a new, clean room in an easily accessable location (great for King St Wharf, Darling Harbour, City shopping, The Rocks, Circular Quay, and transport) then this is a great option. Staff were efficient and helpful. It is super close to the freeway but the rooms are whisper quiet, no need for concern re noise. As a Sydneysider, this is the perfect hotel for when I need a bed for the night and am not interested in the romance of the big/beautiful hotels. Would stay again for that price. Great work Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel but clean and comfortable - excellent location and very good value.”
Reviews.Author: MRDAV64
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in Jan. Clean, comfortable and quiet - the double glazing meant that the freeway outside my window was no problem. The location is fantastic and the staff were very helpful and courteous, particularly the young lady who seemed to be working just about all hours of the day and night. The only (slight) criticism is that the room was on the small side - great for one person but would have been a little cramped for 2, and I did find the shower a little cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed my expectation...”
Reviews.Author: traveluvee
Reviews.Content: I've booked to stay at IBIS King Street Wharf for 9 nights after reading all the great reviews in here. The staffs are all extra friendly and we've had very good feeling about the service the minute we first walked in and were greeted warmly. We arrived at around 12-ish and were managed to checked into our room right away as the staff told us that it was cleaned and ready for us. I was impressed in their flexibility on that as many other hotels I've stayed at always made us wait till the check-in time. We had a standard room and I've read the review before making the booking so we were prepared for the size of our room. However when we walked into our room, we were so happy with the cleanliness that we have forgotten about the size of the room. It sort of made up for it as our first priority in hotels is cleanliness plus no rust can be found in the bathroom. The room is very modern and clean so we didn't mind about the small size at all. It's really not as small as what I've expected. Besides, we spent most of our time traveling outdoor anyway. We just need a very clean room to go home to at the end of the day to sleep and rest. The air-condition was having a malfunction one night and we couldn't sleep at all as it was very hot in Sydney at the time and staying at 7th Floor made it worst coz the heat raised from bottom to top. We went to the front desk to complain about it at 2am after trying very hard to sleep but failed and I was having headache at that time. A staff named Vanessa was wonderful as she tried her very best to look for a room with cooler temperature for us and in the end, we were moved to a superior room at 1st Floor for the rest of our trip (2 nights left). We were very very impressed with IBIS King Street Wharf by that time for being treated fairly and with great ethic. Were given a complimentary 'continental breakfast' which was so-so but it's free so there's nothing to complain about. I won't pay for a breakfast here however as they are with very few selection and does not look appealing. I've been to many hotels and tried many buffet breakfasts so I know the difference when I see one. However, that is a very minor problem as I'm sure the Hotel will do something to improve that as they are still a very new Hotel. Anyway, I will not hesitate for even a second that I will stay in this hotel again the next time I travel to Sydney. Thank you all staff at IBIS King Street Wharf for the great hospitality an we shall see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: gkjacob
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night prior to our Princess Cruise departing Wharf 8 Darling Harbour. The rooms are small, but clean, modern and adequate. For those travelling from Wharf 8 the location is outstanding. In the morning we just wheeled our suitcases downhill a short way and we were at the cruise terminal. Close proximity to King Street Wharf and only a short stroll to Daling Harbour. Cruise travellers will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ajawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 09. We caught the train from the airport to Wynyard Station and had a bit of trouble finding the hotel walking from the train station. The map provided on the hotel's website wasn't very clear. However we did get there in the end and although the room was small, it was very clean and quiet. Being on the third floor our window looked directly out onto a highway, but with roller shutters on the window we could hardly hear it. Great location for walking to the CDB, Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, though there are a few hills to climb. Price is very good value considering it's in the heart of Sydney. Definitely would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but not up to normal Ibis standard”
Reviews.Author: JiEmiraten
Reviews.Content: After staying with Ibis in Europe, Middle East and Asia we have become very fond of the concept: No frills with small but decent rooms with good bed and toilet, and quite nicely designed comon areas. This Ibis has a perfect location, around the corner from Darling Harbour and close to many nice places in the CBD, and we found the price very decent. However, compared to other Ibis hotels, we felt this was below par (very much highlighted as we came straight from the very excellent Ibis in Singapore): The common areas, like restaurant, lobby and hallways were relatively small. As the rooms in Ibis are small by default, the size of these common areas is quite important for the general feeling about the hotel. The air in the room did not smell fresh upon arrival, not very surprising as we then found that the window could not be opened! Internet connection was way too costly, a bit strange as there are two internet cafes across the street charging less than half the Ibis price. Luggage storage came with an extra cost - however, when we protested, the kind staff let us use their office.

Reviews.Title: “good position. tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nakazava
Reviews.Content: good value for money. perfect position, close to downtown while on a quiet area on darling harbour. rooms are too small, but no problem if you don't have many luggage and only stay in to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “this place was just fine”
Reviews.Author: jeanfrombos2n
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Ibis King Street Wharf. We also arrived at about 10 AM after a long trip from the US and the room was ready. Quiet room even on the second floor. We loved the firm platform bed; it's what we have at home too. Yes, the rooms are small, but very well appointed and efficient and clean. I'd stay there again; good price for Sydney, which we found very expensive, and good location--we walked everywhere. And only about two blocks from the train from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieK
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of December. We arrived at about 9am in the morning but were allowed to check in immediately. We really appreciated this, having spent the previous day and a half travelling from the UK. I found every member of staff to be polite and helpful. The location was perfect for us, being near to Darling Harbour for Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife World and the hop-on, hop-off tour bus that stops right across from the hotel. We walked to the Aquarium after dark and I felt that the area was very safe. The previous reviews are correct with regard to the room size and the no frills decor but we didn't spend a lot of time in our room except to sleep so it didn't bother us. We also found the bed very comfortable and the room was spotlessly clean. I had chosen a deal that included breakfast and we were more than happy with the variety of food on offer. All in all, I thought it was excellent value for money and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Management helpful and receptive”
Reviews.Author: Frenchbo
Reviews.Content: I had an unfortunate change in my plans, and management were very receptive to making the changes I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Room so small and sparse it reminded me of a hospital room!”
Reviews.Author: 100kmilesperyear
Reviews.Content: Why a hospital room comparison? Room was tiny and stark with all cold white decor and a TV mounted on wallmount with wires dripping everywhere. There was absolutely no warmth or charm or anything worthwhile about it- this hotel ruined the end of my trip, actually, as the surroundings were so depressing. I stayed in a standard queen room alone (#710) and it is a good thing as there was not enough room for two people to even pass each other in the space- one would have had to step in to the miniscule bathroom or sit on the bed for the other to walk around easily. Decor is modern, but on the very sparse side. Like others noted, the matte finish white paint must pick up smudges and scratches easily as mine was scuffed in several places. Bed is a platform style (i.e. no boxspring or mattress foundation) and very HARD as were the dreadful hard-as-a-rock pillows. ugh. Service was scattered at check in, but they did end up accomodating my request for a higher floor room as I was originally assigned to the first floor and for safety reasons, I do not like to stay close to the ground floor when traveling solo. Nothing at all to recommend about this place except for location, quite close to King Street Wharf string of restaurants and there is wifi throughout entire property- including each guest room- but there is a charge fo $24.95 a day.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location - modern well equipped - small room”
Reviews.Author: MuchTravelled3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was only one year old and was located 2 min walk from Darling harbour. Efficient and friendly staff. Room adequate but quite small with limited hanging space for a couple. Secure baggage drop in own locker ( had to pay ) which was very useful. Extra charge for breakfast, pay either for hot or continental - but it was very good

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: fionarMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Was very nice place to stay and very convenient close to station and short walk from attractions. The room although small was quite adequate and clean, but did require a little more attention to detail as there were dirty fingerprints on the bathroom door and dirty marks on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: nthomson
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay, and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. The hotel's location really is fantastic, just a short walk to Darling Harbour, which was jumping on Fri and Sat night. However hotel is located just far enough away that this does not interfere with a good night's sleep! We found the rooms to be compact, but when in Sydney I don't think that matters, as we hardly spent any time in the room. The rooms are also very clean. The only small negativ point was the lack of toiletries. Our shampoo wasn't refreshed by housekeeping and we had to ask at reception for a new bottle. But that was just a little thing. Overall I would highly receommend this hotel to those people looking for a clean, friendly hotel in an ideal location, that won't break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 2 mins walk to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: londonjp101
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very reasonaly priced considering the location. 2 mins walk to Darling Harbour (King Street Wharf), 15 mins walk to Circular Quay, 10 mins walk to Pitt/George Street. 5 mins walk to ferries, monorail and cityrail (Wynyard Station). The hotel was very clean and facilities in-line with the price. Rooms on the smallish side but very adequate. We had a room overlooking the busy road, but never heard any traffic noise...ever. Staff very friendly and always helpful. If you want to be close to all the attractions that Sydney has to offer but don't want to spend a fortune, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: dr_rob80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on business. Despite overlooking the freeway, the room was unbelievably quiet thanks to the double glazing. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was fine, and the room itself was compact, but quite workable. Check-in staff was quite nice, helped us out answering questions. The real highlight was breakfast. I had a "pay $1 for breakfast" deal, which made it super value. Im not sure how much breakfast normally is, but the spread was quite good and the quality was high. Location was good, close to King St Wharf restaurants and Darling Harbour, and a short walk to Wynyard station the business end of Sydney. Recommended for the solo traveller or short stay couple; not really workable for families or long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, highway next door”
Reviews.Author: geromat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis hotel for four nights. The hotel location is excellent with easy access to Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour. Arriving from the airport by train the hotel is close to Wynyard station. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The rooms are quite small but this did not matter too much to me. Drawback: The window of my room pointed towards the highway. In only a few meters distance the cars and trucks were passing by. Thanks to some isolation there was not too much noise though. Staff was nice and very helpful in getting my bag repaired which had been damaged by the airline.

Reviews.Title: “Standard vs. Deluxe Room”
Reviews.Author: clu488
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis for 4 nights. I booked the standard room but upon arrival I found it quite small in room size (compared to other standard rooms I've stayed in). The standard room is ideally sufficient for one person; but if you're staying with another person and bringing in large luggages, then it's going to be very tight and inconvenient. The main difference between the Standard and the Deluxe/Superior rooms is the floor space. There is much more walking space in the Superior room. Saxon was kind enough to upgrade us to the bigger room when it was available. Rooms are simple and modern, and the hotel is conveniently near the ferries and Darling Harbour. Great value, just be aware of the room size before you book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, all you need!”
Reviews.Author: claramanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and got a good room rate. After 24 hours of flying from the UK, we arrived early in the day with the intention of storing our luggage until check-in time later in the day. However, our fatigue must have been visible and after a couple of hours we were checked in early and given a bigger room that was available. Excellent customer service form start to finish, extremely efficient and helpful staff, nothing was a problem. Breakfast was very good, with everything available regardless from whatever time you appear. Clean and central hotel, 10 out of 10, keep up the good work! Wish we could remember the names of 2 particular members of staff who stood out with their excellent and efficient manner, one being the young lad on the desk on the morning we checked in (13th september, think he said he was from Manila!)and the chap who topped up the breakfast constantly! Thank you for making the start of our holiday a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Petal57
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise- although the rooms are tiny, they are well planned and have everything you need. AND they are spotlessly clean. As others have mentioned, the location is amazing. I found the service to be fantastic- so helpful and friendly- much better than some of the 5 star hotels I have stayed in lately. At the price, this is an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Hugo75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night at Ibis King Street Wharf for a great promotion at whotif.com of 81 AUS$/night. We really enjoyed our stay and the excellent service that was provided by the staff. It got very close to the service you can expect in Asian hotels, which is very rare in Australia. I had sent an e-mail on the central Ibis website requesting a cot for our baby, because they donâ€™t provide individual branch e-mail addresses under contact information. For those who know how French systems work (I worked 3 years for a French multinational, so I know what I am talking about ï�Š) it is no surprise the e-mail never arrived at Ibis King Street Wharf. Maybe this was our luck, because apparently the normal rooms are too small to place a small cot (which really makes me wonder how small they are?) so the woman at the reception arranged room 307 for us which is normally for disabled people who have to enter with their wheelchair and thus is much bigger. The rooms are Ibis style (simple, no frills, clean) but this hotel is very new which made it the best Ibis I stayed in so far. My only comment would be that additional service are too expensive, even for Sydney. Breakfast was around 20 $/person, internet 25$ per night and we were charged 30 $ per night for hotel car park. All together, I would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JDWJ
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful in all ways. Rooms were cleans and made up when we were our venturing everyday. The aircon/heaters were functioning well. Beds were comfortable and a welcome sight after hours of walking. Rooms are small but good enough for travelers that want a comfortable bed to sleep on after sight-seeing the whole day. Also do not expect good views from your hotel windows. The hotel is well located in the city. It is next to Darling Harbour and two or three blocks away from Wynyard train station. For gamblers it is 15mins walk to the Star City Casino! Tip: If you are exploring Sydney for a few days get the RED PASS ticket from any train station. It lets you travel for 7 days on the public ferry, buses and trains for AUD38. The ferry is just a block away from the hotel which takes you past the Opera House and under the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “I will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: agisthos
Reviews.Content: A new Hotel is always an interesting experience. This one is furnished very nicely, the design is great, and it is on the waterfront. Rates are relatively cheap too. I got no ego from the staff, which is how a hotel should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as first”
Reviews.Author: bradlinski
Reviews.Content: Stayed second time. Still good. Great location for me as 2 minutes from our sydney office.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Woody_076
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis King Street Wharf during a 4 day trip to Sydney in March and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of the hotel and service received. The rooms are new and therefore in great condition, very clean and comfortable. The staff are fantastic, very friendly and always remembered my name, even when I couldn't. I had to make a last minute change to my booking and they were very accommodating to my needs. The hotel is situated in a great location, a few seconds walk from King St Wharf itself which has some great restaurants, and a short stroll from the very heart of the great city of Sydney. Whilst the rooms are not huge, they are comfortable, with the bed, linen etc.all of good quality and offering a great nights sleep. I thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of my stay at this hotel and commend the staff on a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and new but very small”
Reviews.Author: balazsd
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 2 small kids and other family members, we stayed on the 7th floor and the staff were excellent and very nice. The rooms were very small as well as the shower, but if you are a traveller that stays there only to sleep then it is ok. I had a great time and it is very centrally located. The only issue I probably had was the room being so small and with 2 toddlers they kept hitting there heads on the glass table and the vanity in the bathroom. Overall though a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but shiny and new”
Reviews.Author: KimandJames
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said Yes the basic rooms at the Ibis King Street Wharf are 'compact' but I knew that before booking and it was important for me not to have to endure a ' well worn ' room. I took my 5yo daughter and it was fine for the two of us, but we only had one suitcase (there was room under the bed for more I guess) The decor was lovely, as was the bathroom and there was nothing missing AND everything was shiny and new!! We had room 611 and this faced the freeway and into some other buildings which was kind of pretty at night - I was impressed at how well the double glazing on the small window worked. One of the "Sydney" websites suggests there is a restaurant - it is only for breakfast but the small bar is open late and I believe it has 'snacks'. There is a convenience store across the road, and only a short walk to all the cafes/restaurants of Darling Harbour. We utilised the King Street Wharf ferry, but you can get there via Wynyard Train Station. I wouldnt try lugging luggage back up to Wynyard though (weekend access limited) We took the ferry around to Circular Quay, then caught the train from there back to the airport. I booked direct on the Ibis website, as there wasnt much difference between that and the usual last minute booking sites. (it was a Saturday night)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cookieUk
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here over the Mardi Gras weekend. Although it was a busy weekend in Sydney the rate we got was really good. Yes the rooms are a little small but why go to Sydney to hang out in a hotel room! The room was extremely clean and quiet. The location is excellent with everything we wanted to see well within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and when I left my Blackberry charger there it was promptly returned to me â€“ thanks Benjamin! The breakfast was great with a selection of fruit, cereal and warm food. It was a good start to the day! Next time I am in Sydney I would be more than willing to stay here again. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mhnstr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March and were really pleased. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Darling Harbor and about 20 minutes from the Opera House. The surrounding area includes some 24 hour convenience stores and a few restaurants, but most of the restaurants are in Darling Harbor or Pitt St, only a few minutes walk away. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a rollaway bed in our room which was nice and not at all as bad as one might fear. Overall, we were very pleased with the room. The breakfast is from 6 to 10 and has a lot to offer. It is worth adding if you choose one of the room bookings with breakfast. The staff are a real benefit of staying here as well. They are friendly and courteous and helpful. They knew our names when they saw us in the morning and could give advice regarding sites to see. In all, a very good experience. I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it. One word of advice if you are coming from the airport. If you take the train, get off at the Wynyard station and walk to the hotel (about 10 minutes depending on which door you exit). However, this is a really bad way to get to the hotel. Save money, time and walking by taking one of the shuttles from the airport to the hotel for less than the cost of the train.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location...but the rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: Opanook
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from a weekend in Sydney with friends. Three couples all staying at the Ibis Hotel King Street Wharf. The hotel is in a good location - a few blocks walk from Wynyard Railway Station and a block from King Street Wharf/Darling Harbour. Checking in to the hotel was no problem with the staff friendly and welcoming. Our friends were already checked in and after mentioning this to the receptionist, she changed us to the same floor. Nothing seemed to be a problem. We phoned later to get a bottle opener and it was delivered very quickly with no fuss. Would have been nice to have one in the room though. When we entered our room, we were a little surprised to see how tiny it was. Just enough space for the bed, mini fridge, small table & chair and bathroom. My 5ft 11 boyfriend slept with his feet hanging over the end of the bed. We had to shuffle around each other which was a little annoying. For a one night stay, that was ok, but a few days of this would have driven us nuts. The bathroom (shower & toilet) was also on the small side but ok for what you had to do in there. Was also surprising to see timber floors in the room - was fine, but something I hadn't seen before. The room was clean, tidy and the bed comfortable. The hotel is new, so everything is still looking and feeling lovely. It was quiet with double glass windows (also small) considering we had a major road going past our window. Checking out was fine and handled professionally but felt a little sorry for the receptionist as it was right on check-out time and the foyer was packed. He handled it well and everyone seemed ok. No cranky people or yelling. A good sign. We did hear from a few of the other guests in passing who had had issues with a mistake with the parking charge, elevators that couldn't find the basement levels and a room that smelt like cigarette smoke (a unconsiderate previous guest who didn't follow the rules obviously!...which is out of the control of the hotel). We thought the hotel was affordable, clean, tidy, in a good location with friendly staff and would definitely consider staying here again for a night. My only other recommendation would be to larger, taller people - you may need to consider somewhere else with more space.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, watch for the parking charges”
Reviews.Author: Ambra60
Reviews.Content: The hotel had only been open for 15 days. The reception staff were still learning and so were slow. Parking is a problem. The hotel has a small number of sapces in an underground unit at the back of the Hotel. We only paid $99 dollars for one night accomodation but were charged $30 dollars for parking! No mention of this when we booked in or arrived, only when we wanted to leave. The rooms are small but well equiped. Wireless internet is available free. It is just a short walk across the road to Kings wharf and into Darling Harbour. There is also a great cafe outside the front entrance for breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Sydney King Street Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Shelley Street, King Street Wharf | Corner Erskine Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
